chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Jeffrey Garsomke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Jeffrey Garsomke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Jeffrey Garsomke was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Matthew Jeffrey Garsomke was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Concurrent with: Probation is to run concurrent on counts 2&6 and to the present probation case

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions. 

 Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling/programing/evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant may apply for expungement of this case no sooner than 5 years from the date of this conviction provided probation has been successfully completed, no further criminal convictions, and no forfeiture matters related to alcohol or drugs.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcment agent .

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence applies to count 2 only. Defendant granted credit for 60 days served

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was granted 184 days credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Prison Sentence on Ct 2 is consecutive to the jail sentence on Ct 6 in this same case

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Fees, surcharges amd costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
he defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  
Defendant is not to possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Additionally, defendant may possess prescription drugs only when prescribed by a medical professional for the defendant, which shall be taken as prescribed.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Prison Sentence on Ct 2 is consecutive to Jail Sentence on Ct 6 in this same case
